parameters.description: The caller is required to set Avi Version Header to the expected version of configuration. The response from the controller will provide and accept data according to the specified version. The controller will reject POST and PUT requests where the data is not compatible with the specified version.
parameters.name: X-Avi-Version

parameters.description: Avi Controller may send back CSRF token in the response cookies. The caller should update the request headers with this token else controller will reject requests.
parameters.name: X-CSRFToken

parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.
parameters.name: include_name

parameters.description: Default values are not set.
parameters.name: skip_default

parameters.description: It automatically returns additional dependent resources like runtime. Eg. join_subresources=runtime.
parameters.name: join_subresources

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that refers to another Avi resource. Its syntax is refers_to=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all virtual services referring to pool p1 will be refers_to=pool:pool_p1_uuid
parameters.name: refers_to

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that are referred by another Avi resource. Its syntax is referred_by=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all pools referred_by virtual service vs1 - referred_by=virtualservice:vs_vs1_uuid
parameters.name: referred_by

parameters.description: List of fields to be returned for the resource. Some fields like name, URL, uuid etc. are always returned.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.

parameters.name: skip_default

type.description: Configure one of either proxy or fast path profiles. Enum options - PROTOCOL_TYPE_TCP_PROXY, PROTOCOL_TYPE_TCP_FAST_PATH, PROTOCOL_TYPE_UDP_FAST_PATH, PROTOCOL_TYPE_UDP_PROXY.

tcp_proxy_profile.description: Placeholder for description of property tcp_proxy_profile of obj type NetworkProfileUnion field type str  type object

tcp_fast_path_profile.description: Placeholder for description of property tcp_fast_path_profile of obj type NetworkProfileUnion field type str  type object

udp_fast_path_profile.description: Placeholder for description of property udp_fast_path_profile of obj type NetworkProfileUnion field type str  type object

udp_proxy_profile.description: Configure UDP Proxy network profile. Field introduced in 17.2.8, 18.1.3, 18.2.1.

per_pkt_loadbalance.description: When enabled, every UDP packet is considered a new transaction and may be load balanced to a different server.  When disabled, packets from the same client source IP and port are sent to the same server.

snat.description: When disabled, Source NAT will not be performed for all client UDP packets.

session_idle_timeout.description: The amount of time (in sec) for which a flow needs to be idle before it is deleted. Allowed values are 2-3600.

profile.description: Placeholder for description of property profile of obj type NetworkProfile field type str  type object

_last_modified.description: UNIX time since epoch in microseconds. Units(MICROSECONDS).

description.description: User defined description for the object.

tenant_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type Tenant.

name.description: The name of the network profile.

connection_mirror.description: When enabled, Avi mirrors all TCP fastpath connections to standby. Applicable only in Legacy HA Mode. Field introduced in 18.1.3,18.2.1.

receive_window.description: Size of the receive window. Allowed values are 32-65536.

aggressive_congestion_avoidance.description: Controls the our congestion window to send, normally it's 1 mss, If this option is turned on, we use 10 msses.

cc_algo.description: Controls the congestion control algorithm we use. Enum options - CC_ALGO_NEW_RENO, CC_ALGO_CUBIC, CC_ALGO_HTCP.

reorder_threshold.description: Controls the number of duplicate acks required to trigger retransmission. Setting a higher value reduces retransmission caused by packet reordering. A larger value is recommended in public cloud environments where packet reordering is quite common. The default value is 8 in public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), and 3 in other environments. Allowed values are 1-100. Field introduced in 17.2.7.

max_syn_retransmissions.description: The maximum number of attempts at retransmitting a SYN packet before giving up. Allowed values are 3-8.

congestion_recovery_scaling_factor.description: Congestion window scaling factor after recovery. Allowed values are 0-8. Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.3, 18.2.1.

reassembly_queue_size.description: Maximum number of TCP segments that can be queued for reassembly. Configuring this to 0 disables the feature and provides unlimited queuing. Field introduced in 17.2.13, 18.1.4, 18.2.1.

max_retransmissions.description: The number of attempts at retransmit before closing the connection. Allowed values are 3-8.

use_interface_mtu.description: Use the interface MTU to calculate the TCP max segment size.

time_wait_delay.description: The time (in millisec) to wait before closing a connection in the TIME_WAIT state. Allowed values are 500-2000. Special values are 0 - 'immediate'.

nagles_algorithm.description: Consolidates small data packets to send clients fewer but larger packets.  Adversely affects real time protocols such as telnet or SSH.

idle_connection_timeout.description: The duration for keepalive probes or session idle timeout. Max value is 3600 seconds, min is 5.  Set to 0 to allow infinite idle time. Allowed values are 5-3600. Special values are 0 - 'infinite'.

ignore_time_wait.description: A new SYN is accepted from the same 4-tuple even if there is already a connection in TIME_WAIT state.  This is equivalent of setting Time Wait Delay to 0.

max_segment_size.description: Maximum TCP segment size. Allowed values are 512-9000. Special values are 0 - 'Use Interface MTU'.

idle_connection_type.description: Controls the behavior of idle connections. Enum options - KEEP_ALIVE, CLOSE_IDLE.

slow_start_scaling_factor.description: Congestion window scaling factor during slow start. Allowed values are 0-8. Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.3, 18.2.1.

min_rexmt_timeout.description: The minimum wait time (in millisec) to retransmit packet. Allowed values are 50-5000. Field introduced in 17.2.8.

automatic.description: Dynamically pick the relevant parameters for connections.

ip_dscp.description: Controls the value of the Differentiated Services Code Point field inserted in the IP header.  This has two options   Set to a specific value, or Pass Through, which uses the incoming DSCP value. Allowed values are 0-63. Special values are MAX - 'Passthrough'.

session_idle_timeout.description: The amount of time (in sec) for which a flow needs to be idle before it is deleted. Allowed values are 2-3600. Field introduced in 17.2.8, 18.1.3, 18.2.1.

enable_syn_protection.description: When enabled, Avi will complete the 3-way handshake with the client before forwarding any packets to the server.  This will protect the server from SYN flood and half open SYN connections.

session_idle_timeout.description: The amount of time (in sec) for which a connection needs to be idle before it is eligible to be deleted. Allowed values are 5-3600. Special values are 0 - 'infinite'.
